@graph.name: Vegan Fish Tacos - Baja Style « Dora's Table
@graph.description: These crispy, creamy, yet tender vegan fish tacos will conquer any tofu skeptic. The tofu is fried in batter then served on warm tortillas.

itemListElement.name: Home
Main Course
Vegan Fish Tacos - Baja Style

@graph.name: Dora S.
@graph.description: Dora is the founder, recipe developer, and photographer at Dora's Table and Mi Mero Mole. Born and raised in Mexico and a graduate of the Culinary Institute of America in New York, she adopted a vegan (plant-based) diet to take control of her health.

@graph.name: Vegan Fish Tacos - Baja Style
@graph.description: These crispy, creamy, yet tender vegan fish tacos will conquer any tofu skeptic. The tofu is fried in batter then served on warm tortillas.
recipeIngredient: 16 oz. Extra firm or high protein tofu
1/2 tsp. Neutral oil - I used grape seed ((optional))
1/4 tsp. Kelp/dulse granules or crumbled / powdered nori
1 cup Organic all purpose flour or all purpose gf flour
1/4 tsp. Turmeric powder for color (( optional))
1/2 tsp. Sea salt  or to taste
Neutral Oil for frying (like refined coconut or sunflower seed oil)
3 tbsp. Cashew or almond crema (or vegan sour cream or more vegan mayo)
Lemon juice (as needed to thin out the sauce)

itemListElement.text: Mix all dry ingredients in a bowl and make a well in the center. Pour the sparkling water or beer and slowly mix with a ballon whisk or egg beater until everything is incorporated without overmixing.
itemListElement.name: Mix all dry ingredients in a bowl and make a well in the center. Pour the sparkling water or beer and slowly mix with a ballon whisk or egg beater until everything is incorporated without overmixing.

itemListElement.text: Cover and store in the refrigerator for 15 minutes to an hour.
itemListElement.name: Cover and store in the refrigerator for 15 minutes to an hour.

itemListElement.text: Mix all the marinade ingredients in a shallow container or baking dish and set aside.
itemListElement.name: Mix all the marinade ingredients in a shallow container or baking dish and set aside.

itemListElement.text: Press the tofu for about 20 minutes to remove the excess water, then cut lengthwise into 1/2 inch slabs or fillets.
itemListElement.name: Press the tofu for about 20 minutes to remove the excess water, then cut lengthwise into 1/2 inch slabs or fillets.

itemListElement.text: Place in the dish and marinade for at least 20 minutes. Flip  them half way to make sure all sides are coated and the tofu soaks up all the flavor.
itemListElement.name: Place in the dish and marinade for at least 20 minutes. Flip  them half way to make sure all sides are coated and the tofu soaks up all the flavor.

itemListElement.text: While the tofu marinates, prepare the pico de gallo and mayo sauce.
itemListElement.name: While the tofu marinates, prepare the pico de gallo and mayo sauce.

itemListElement.text: In a small bowl combine all the pico de gallo ingredients then add the lemon and salt and pepper.
itemListElement.name: In a small bowl combine all the pico de gallo ingredients then add the lemon and salt and pepper.

itemListElement.text: Taste and add more seasonings or lemon if desired. If you like your pico de gallo spicy, add a finely chopped serrano or jalapeño chile.
itemListElement.name: Taste and add more seasonings or lemon if desired. If you like your pico de gallo spicy, add a finely chopped serrano or jalapeño chile.

itemListElement.text: Mix the both the mayo and the cashew crema with a wire whisk or fork until all is incorporated. Add lemon juice to taste and until desired consistency.
itemListElement.name: Mix the both the mayo and the cashew crema with a wire whisk or fork until all is incorporated. Add lemon juice to taste and until desired consistency.

itemListElement.text: Season with salt. Store both the pico de gallo and sauce in the refrigerator until ready to use.
itemListElement.name: Season with salt. Store both the pico de gallo and sauce in the refrigerator until ready to use.

itemListElement.text: To recreate the taste of the sea, measure and cut the nori sheets to cover one side of the tofu fillets, placing the rough side of the nori on top of the tofu (shiny side up).
itemListElement.name: To recreate the taste of the sea, measure and cut the nori sheets to cover one side of the tofu fillets, placing the rough side of the nori on top of the tofu (shiny side up).

itemListElement.text: Using your fingers, gently apply some of the marinade to help it stick to the tofu or squeeze some more lemon juice on top.
itemListElement.name: Using your fingers, gently apply some of the marinade to help it stick to the tofu or squeeze some more lemon juice on top.

itemListElement.text: Using a heavy bottom saucepan or deep fryer, bring the oil to medium heat. The oil is ready when you add a drop of batter to the oil and sizzles.
itemListElement.name: Using a heavy bottom saucepan or deep fryer, bring the oil to medium heat. The oil is ready when you add a drop of batter to the oil and sizzles.

itemListElement.text: Prepare your cooking stations before beginning to help you stay organized: dish with marinated tofu, batter bowl, saucepan and a large plate lined with paper towels.
itemListElement.name: Prepare your cooking stations before beginning to help you stay organized: dish with marinated tofu, batter bowl, saucepan and a large plate lined with paper towels.

itemListElement.text: Using a fork and spoon, place the tofu in the batter and gently spoon the batter on top, this will ensure that the nori sheet stays on the tofu, you will need to do this in several batches.
itemListElement.name: Using a fork and spoon, place the tofu in the batter and gently spoon the batter on top, this will ensure that the nori sheet stays on the tofu, you will need to do this in several batches.

itemListElement.text: Drop the fillets in the oil giving enough space between them, about 2 to 3 since you don’t want to overcrowd the pan.
itemListElement.name: Drop the fillets in the oil giving enough space between them, about 2 to 3 since you don’t want to overcrowd the pan.

itemListElement.text: Cook tofu fillets for 3-5 minutes or until the edges are browned. Remove from the oil and place on your plate with paper towels to cool down. Continue with the rest of the tofu until done.
itemListElement.name: Cook tofu fillets for 3-5 minutes or until the edges are browned. Remove from the oil and place on your plate with paper towels to cool down. Continue with the rest of the tofu until done.

itemListElement.text: Serve on warmed tortillas, with the pico de gallo, mayo sauce, chopped cucumber, cabbage, and extra lemon.
itemListElement.name: Serve on warmed tortillas, with the pico de gallo, mayo sauce, chopped cucumber, cabbage, and extra lemon.

@graph.keywords: baja style tacos, vegan baja tacos, vegan fish tacos
